Key Match Events: Michael Harris II made a jaw-dropping home run robbery in the seventh inning, which was considered one of the best catches by both the Braves and Phillies.
Edmundo Sosa hit a solo home run in the second inning.
Trea Turner hit a solo home run in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Philadelphia manager Rob Thomson praised Harris' catch, calling it one of the best catches ever seen in the game.
Atlanta manager Brian Snitker told Harris that his catch was the 'catch of the year' and mentioned they would be watching it for the next 24 hours.
Max Fried, the Braves pitcher, expressed awe at Harris' catch, calling it a very special play and probably the best catch he has ever had behind him.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Braves starting pitchers have allowed three runs or fewer in 20 straight games, extending their longest single-season streak since the mound was moved to its current distance in 1893.
With losses in two of the first three games of the four-game series, the Braves have fallen six games behind the first-place Phillies in the National League East.
